question.title: Replace bean defined in Spring Boot starter
question.body:
My Spring Boot app has a dependency on a starter that defines a bean

@Bean
@ConditionalOnMissingBean(SomeBean.class)
public SomeBean someBean() {
    var someBean = new SomeBean();
    someBean.doSomething();
    someBean.doSomething2();
    someBean.doSomething3();
    someBean.doSomething4();
    return someBean;
}

I can replace this by defining my own bean of the same type

@Configuration
public class MyConfiguration {

    @Bean
    public SomeBean someBean() {
        var someBean = new SomeBean();
        someBean.doSomething();
        someBean.doSomething2();
        someBean.doSomething3();
        someBean.doSomething4();

        someBean.doSomethingCustom();    
        return someBean;
    }
}

The downside of this approach is that I need to copy-paste the bean initialisation code from the starter. I would prefer instead to do something like this

@Configuration
public class MyConfiguration {

    @Bean
    public SomeBean someBean(SomeBean starterBean) {    
        starterBean.doSomethingCustom();    
        return starterBean;
    }
}

But this causes the error

The dependencies of some of the beans in the application context form a cycle

Can I can replace the starter bean with my own bean without duplicating the bean initialisation code from the starter?
